Since I am not aware of your specific disability, it is difficult to say which activity in Bled would be the best for you. However, here is a general overview of the activities mentioned and who they may be suitable for:

1. Hiking: The accessibility of hiking dependents on the nature of your disability. Some tourists with mobility impairments may find the terrain challenging or impossible. However, you may enjoy hiking with the help of specialized equipment like off-road wheelchairs, hiking poles, or personal assistance.

2. Kayaking: Kayaking is an accessible activity that can adapt to different abilities. Most rental providers have kayaks that can accommodate visitors with physical disabilities. You can also opt for an electric-powered kayak if you have limited strength or mobility.

3. Cycling: Cycling can be suitable for people who can maintain balance and have enough upper body strength. Several local rental shops offer adaptive bicycles that address a wide range of disabilities.

4. Horse-drawn carriage ride: If you have mobility difficulties, the horse-drawn carriage can be an excellent way to explore and take in the picturesque views without physical effort.

In general, I would suggest contacting activity providers beforehand to inquire about their accessibility for people with disabilities. They will likely be happy to offer recommendations and useful information for you.
